importantArticles.headline: Investors are digesting tariff whiplash after the White House confirmed plans to levy 104% tariffs on China, set to go into effect at 12:01am ET.
importantArticles.title: Stock market today: Dow loses steam, S&P 500, Nasdaq reverse gains as White House confirms 104% tariffs on China

importantArticles.headline: After a brutal last week on Trump tariff concerns, Wall Street attempted to bounce back on April 7. Can the rebound last?
importantArticles.title: Is Market Rebound a Value Play or Value Trap? ETFs in Focus

importantArticles.headline: After a brutal last week on Trump tariff concerns, Wall Street attempted to bounce back on April 7. Can the rebound last?

importantArticles.headline: While many on Wall Street are cutting their year-end price targets after Trump's tariff announcement, one strategist is still calling for a rebound.
importantArticles.title: One Wall Street bull still sees a stock market rally: 'These levies will eventually be negotiated lower'

importantArticles.headline: Wall Street is slashing its bullish outlook for stocks as investors digest the impact of President Trump's tariffs.
importantArticles.title: Wall Street stock bulls throw in the towel as tariff market meltdown 'projects negative outcomes to infinity'

importantArticles.headline: - Equities extended their losing streak as VOO, SPY hit bear market territory intraday. - Bond ETFs also dropped as Trump threatens more China tariffs. - Recession and interest rate hike fears pushed investors into buffer ETFs: Innovator. - NOTE: Clarifies seventh paragraph to say around $850 million in buffer ETFs were traded on Friday.
importantArticles.title: Stock, Bond ETFs React to Tariff News; VOO Hits Bear Market
